alert.note: Alert for Bossier; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 29 at 5:17AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Webster and southeastern Bossier Parishes through 545 AM CDT... At 517 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles west of Ringgold, or 16 miles southeast of Bossier City, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bossier City, Minden, Haughton, Sibley, Doyline, Dixie Inn, Eastwood, Princeton, Curtis, Taylortown, Elm Grove, Fillmore, Bodcau, Plum Orchard Landing, Koran, Gilark, Noles Landing, Lake Bistineau North, Mc Dade and Sligo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
